title: Gujarat Man On FBI's Top Ten Wanted List For Brutally Murdering His Wife, Manhunt Launched
text:
It's considered to be one of the biggest manhunts launched by FBI and it's for a man hailing from Gujarat for brutally murdering his wife in the U.S.

According to reports, Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is hunting for an Indian fugitive, Bhadresh Kumar Patel, for the past four years.

IANS

FBI detectives and informants have been trying hard to nab Patel, however, his whereabouts are still a huge mystery.

According to an IANS report, Patel is termed as a cold-blooded murderer and an 'extremely dangerous' criminal who killed his young wife at a Dunkin' Donuts store in Hanover, Maryland, in the most bizarre way.

"Patel's wife Palak was young and the scene was very brutal... She was killed in a horrible way, that's the kind of person (killer) we are dealing with."

Back in April 2015, Patel and his wife Palak were working in night shift in the Dunkin' Donuts store. The CCTV footage of the night of the crime showed Bhadresh and Palak walking together towards the store's kitchen before disappearing behind the racks.

Indian in FBI's top 10 most wanted list, biggest ever hunt launched nbsp;Considered as one of the biggest ever simultaneous chases in the US and India, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) is hunting for an Indian fugitive, Bhadresh Kumar Patel, f… https://t.co/kHPyDtFISr pic.twitter.com/tHUCHFTHZE — Today Bharat News (@TodayBharatNews) October 19, 2019

After brutally beating and stabbing Palak to death, Patel left the store and returned to his nearby apartment by foot. According to witnessed he remained unfazed the whole time, as though nothing happened.

"The extremely violent nature of the crimes allegedly committed by Bhadreshkumar Patel earned him a place on the FBI's Top Ten List," Gordon B Johnson, the Special Agent in Charge of the FBI's Baltimore Field Office, said in a statement.

FBI

Patel later checked into a hotel in Newark and was seen at the counter paying in cash for a room. He slept over the night and left the hotel in the morning.

Bhadresh Patel continues to run from one place to another, his name continues to figure in the latest FBI list (2019), which includes some of the most dreaded fugitives.

Posters with different photographs of Patel have been printed in English, Hindi, Gujarati, Marathi and even in French and they have been circulated in different parts of the world where Patel could hide, reports IANS.

Police said Bhadreshkumar, originally from Kantrodi Ta Viramgam, Gujarat, India, had a visa to be in the US, but it had expired and there was no indication he was able to legally leave the country, the report said.
